channel.title: Read here before quickly opening a topic!
channel.description:
1) Hi, please [b]don't[/b] re-create a thread that already exists and has been answered. It saves a lot of time for people that are trying to help you. What I mean by this is just say if someone opened a topic saying "Need help finding Java", you don't need to make a new thread saying "Where's Java I need help?" it's probably already been answered.
2) Also even though it's already been covered I'd like to say be specific in your title threads! Instead of saying "I need help" say "I need help on..."
3) DON'T create a poll if it's just going to be spam, what's the point?
Thanks and happing posting. :)
~ 99
NOTE: Please [b][u]DON'T[/u][/b] spam this thread! Thanks! :)[br][size=1]Posted on: May 08, 2007, 12:42:28 AM[/size][hr]Also if you think I should add things to this just say! Thanks! :)

  1. Hi, please don’t re-create a thread that already exists and has been answered. It saves a lot of time for people that are trying to help you. What I mean by this is just say if someone opened a topic saying “Need help finding Java”, you don’t need to make a new thread saying “Where’s Java I need help?” it’s probably already been answered.
